studyAmendmentImpacts.description: Revised title to change fibrosis stages from 'F2 Through F4' to 'F1 Through F4'
Multiple clarifications including fibrosis stage definitions, NASH indication terminology, dosing schedule clarification, and screening period requirements
Removed Inclusion Criterion #4 (FAST Score), revised Criterion #6 to lower NAS requirement from ≥4 to ≥3 and fibrosis stage from F2 to F1
Revised Exclusion Criteria #1, #2, #6a, #7, #17, #21, #25, #26 including removal of SARS-CoV-2 infection criterion
Added statements related to screening period extension, SARS-CoV-2 testing requirements, and rescreening allowances
Added cap of four participants with F1 fibrosis enrollment
Restructured tables, added new Table 2 for Visit 4a and 4a2, revised footnotes and column structure
Added definition statement for adverse events and new subsection for pretreatment-emergent adverse events
Removed 'dose increased' and 'dose reduced' from Action Taken options
Removed 4-week waiting period requirement for rescreening
Added instruction for immunogenicity sample collection when worsening of disease is reported as AE

studyAmendmentReasons.reasonText: Revise inclusion and exclusion criteria to improve study feasibility
Clarify the screening period eligibility and extension of its duration
Clarify the acceptable conditions for including SARS-CoV-2-infected participants into the study and to allow adequate time for recovery of symptoms before screening
Clarification of terminology and procedures throughout protocol
To have a wider and diverse range of participants from all fibrosis stages (F1 through F4cc) enrolled in the study
To improve study feasibility by expanding the study inclusion parameters while maintaining a population that is optimal for assessing the anti-inflammatory/anti-fibrogenic mechanism of this drug
NAS ≥4 to NAS ≥3 to reduce screen failures on NAS subscores due to nonreliability of the ballooning score
To improve study feasibility, recognizing the study population to be enrolled (HbA1c requirement change)
To correct the list of possible actions that can be taken in response to an adverse event, given that a single dose of ontamalimab (75 mg) is available for use in this study
To allow participants to rescreen on a case-by-case basis after discussion with the investigator
To clarify the instructions for collection of samples for immunogenicity in case of worsening of a disease being reported as an AE

studyChanges.beforeText: A Multicenter, Single-arm, Open-label, Phase 1b Study to Explore the Mechanism of Action and Evaluate the Safety of Ontamalimab in Participants With Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis With Fibrosis Stages 2 Through 4
studyChanges.afterText: A Multicenter, Single-arm, Open-label, Phase 1b Study to Explore the Mechanism of Action and Evaluate the Safety of Ontamalimab in Participants With Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis With Fibrosis Stage 1 Through 4
studyChanges.summary: Changed fibrosis stage range from F2-F4 to F1-F4 in protocol title

studyChanges.beforeText: Ontamalimab will be administered at Day 1 and Q4W thereafter for up to 24 weeks (last dose at Week 20)
studyChanges.afterText: Ontamalimab will be administered subcutaneously (SC) every 4 weeks (Q4W) starting on Day 1 and the last dose is administered at Week 20 (total treatment period is 24 weeks)
studyChanges.summary: Clarified dosing schedule and administration route

studyChanges.afterText: Not more than four participants with F1 fibrosis will be enrolled in this study
studyChanges.summary: Added cap on F1 fibrosis participant enrollment

studyChanges.beforeText: Inclusion Criterion #4 (FibroScan-aspartate aminotransferase [FAST] Score as eligibility criterion for liver biopsy)
studyChanges.summary: Removed FAST Score as eligibility criterion for liver biopsy

studyChanges.beforeText: The participant has a diagnosis of NASH confirmed via biopsy (NAS ≥4 with at least 1 point each in steatosis, ballooning, and lobular inflammation) and liver fibrosis stage F2, F3, or F4cc according to NASH CRN, and established according to appropriate guidelines
studyChanges.afterText: The participant has indication of NASH via biopsy (NAS ≥3 with at least 1 point in lobular inflammation) and liver fibrosis stage F1 through F4cc according to NASH CRN
studyChanges.summary: Lowered NAS requirement from ≥4 to ≥3, removed steatosis and ballooning requirements, expanded fibrosis stages to include F1

studyChanges.beforeText: Enrollment of F2 and F3 participants at a 1:1 ratio will not be required
studyChanges.afterText: Enrollment of F1, F2 and F3 participants at a 1:1:1 ratio will not be required
studyChanges.summary: Updated enrollment ratio statement to include F1 participants
Increased HbA1c exclusion threshold from ≥8% to ≥9%

studyChanges.beforeText: Exclusion Criterion #17: severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus-2 (SARS-CoV-2) infection
studyChanges.summary: Removed SARS-CoV-2 infection as exclusion criterion

studyChanges.beforeText: The following laboratory findings are exclusionary for all participants if found during either screening visit (Week -8 or Week -6)
studyChanges.afterText: The following laboratory findings are exclusionary for all participants if found during screening visits (Week -8 [SV1], Week -6 [SV2] or at Day -4 visit [Visit 4a2])
studyChanges.summary: Added Day -4 visit to screening laboratory exclusion timeframe

studyChanges.afterText: Treatment with leukocyte apheresis or selective lymphocyte, monocyte, or granulocyte apheresis or plasma exchange 30 days before baseline (Day 1)
studyChanges.summary: Added additional exclusion criterion #7 regarding apheresis treatments

studyChanges.beforeText: An individual who has been designated a screen failure may be rescreened once, except for participants who fail the histological evaluation of the liver biopsy.
studyChanges.afterText: An individual who has been designated a screen failure may be rescreened once
studyChanges.summary: Removed exception for histological evaluation failures from rescreening allowance

studyChanges.beforeText: after 4 weeks of last sample taken at the initial screening
studyChanges.summary: Removed 4-week waiting period requirement for rescreening

studyChanges.afterText: Maximum allowed time between historical liver biopsy and first dose of study drug is 34 weeks for any participant, except for the participants who test positive for SARS-CoV-2 at screening
studyChanges.summary: Added maximum time allowance for historical liver biopsy

studyChanges.afterText: In case of positive test for SARS-CoV-2 infection, screening may be paused for an additional 2 weeks (ie, screening period of up to 12 weeks)
studyChanges.summary: Added screening extension allowance for SARS-CoV-2 positive participants

studyChanges.afterText: The screening period can be extended by 2 weeks for any reason (including but not limited to a repeat test requirement for select and predefined measurements) on a case-by-case basis with the sponsor's approval
studyChanges.summary: Added general screening extension allowance with sponsor approval

studyChanges.beforeText: During the screening period, Pro-C3, ELF, and other exploratory markers will be measured at 3 visits (including Day 1 predose) to determine intra-participant variability.
studyChanges.afterText: Pro-C3, ELF, and other exploratory markers will be measured at 2 screening visits (SV1 and SV2) and Day 1 [D1] predose measurement during treatment period to determine intra-participant variability.
studyChanges.summary: Clarified biomarker measurement timing across screening and treatment periods
Removed dose modification options from Action Taken list since single dose is used

studyChanges.afterText: and samples for immunogenicity should be collected when worsening of a disease is reported as an AE
studyChanges.summary: Added instruction for immunogenicity sample collection during disease worsening AEs

studyChanges.afterText: an adverse event (AE) is defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation participant who has signed informed consent to participate in a study; it does not necessarily have to have a causal relationship with the treatment
studyChanges.summary: Added explicit definition of adverse event
Added new subsection defining pretreatment-emergent adverse events

studyChanges.beforeText: Table 1. Schedule of Activities: Screening Period
studyChanges.afterText: Table 1. Schedule of Activities: Screening Period (Visit 1 and 2)
studyChanges.summary: Revised table title to specify visits covered

studyChanges.afterText: Table 2. Schedule of Activities: Screening Period (Visit 4a and 4a2)
studyChanges.summary: Added new table for Visit 4a and 4a2 screening activities

studyChanges.beforeText: Columns for Visit 4a and Visit 4a2 in Table Schedule of Activities: Treatment Period
studyChanges.summary: Removed Visit 4a and 4a2 columns from treatment period table (moved to new screening table)
